website_summaries.verdict: A powerful air conditioning unit that churns out 12,000 BTU and exhausts all condensate.
pros: Ideal for areas where a window unit is not available
Operation modes include cool, dehumidify, and fan
Window kit for exhaust hose included
Casters allow you to move the unit around a space
cons: Leaks may develop after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water on floor.
customer_reviews.text: It is quite. Low, med and high fan do not change much. Love the dual hose. However, it leaks water all over the floor. Drain plug is tight so it is something else. Also it was not packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: DaKon

customer_reviews.title: Not a true dual hose, will collapse a shiftpod
customer_reviews.text: i bought this unit for use in a shift pod. it collapsed the tent on first use. i didnt have it fully staked down, but thats not really the point. i opened up the unit and discovered that the intake side of the "outside" intake/exhaust section is not sealed off. it will pull air from the inside and blow it out as fast as it can cool it. i built a box around the intake side using abs plastic sheet, and aluminum hvac tape. i sealed up every part hat i could find, and used one of the hose couplings to make a port. tent is ice cold now.
customer_reviews.author: George mosko

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as a portable AC probably can
customer_reviews.text: Compared to our previous single hose unit from Black and Decker, this thing is amazing. It actually successfully cools our 300 square foot living room, which was not the case with our previous unit. It also gets much colder and you'd feel uncomfortable standing next to it on full blast. Coupled with a floor fan, it works well, albeit not as well as a wall or window unit. Still, it portable is your only choice, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere. This is all false hype.
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY thing good about this unit is the window kit. It wasn't as hard as other units. This thing worked good during its 1st week. That's it. I used it a month later and all it does is struggle and rattle. Now its loud. The condenser rattles AND the fan. You think it would cool a small 160sft room, it does not. The room doesn't get below 80 degrees. Contacted support and they had me put a thermometer directly in the fan to test temp. It blew cold but the room is still 80 on an 83 degree day... DONT BUY THIS. Get a window unit or a fan. Wish I could get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: E.S. 2

customer_reviews.title: Great portable AC but needs to install a drain hose for optimal use
customer_reviews.text: Great portable AC, switched from a single hose unit and this was night and day different. Quiet and cooling. It does drain alot so get a drain hose from home Depot (picture attached)
customer_reviews.author: ML_ted

customer_reviews.title: Loud and a pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and really wanted it to work but it is quite noisy and not really in a white noise kind of way. Rather it sounds like a constant gurgling. Additionally, you need to lift this rather heavy unit to empt the water that collects inside it. Does it cool? Yes, but with noise and work on your part to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Hippo studios

customer_reviews.title: No AC water leaking like my roommate's unit
customer_reviews.text: Works alright except it's very loud. It's not a problem since you'll get used to it. Extremely powerful for 1 bedroom though but I'll keep it. I live in SOCAL and this unit automatically spray the condensed water out of the hose. No AC water leaking like my roommate's unit. One thing to note though if you're planning on using this product to dehumidify your room, it doesn't come with drainage hose. You'll have to buy it from the manufacture's website, which was very hard to find and cost $15. Otherwise the unit would stop running once the water reserve is filled up.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Has No Cooling Power!
customer_reviews.text: Does nothing to cool down. Noise level is impressively low but what good is it when it can't cool the room even after running full blast for more than 2 hours? Front display is almost impossible to read unless you get few inches from it. It also doesn't have built-in automatic evaporator so you either have to run a hose or drain it manually. I purchased this since it was the first recommendation by Amazon (not the buyers) and was a total disappointment. Opted to purchase LG LP1215GXR (second purchase) even though it is considerably louder. LG has more features and cooling power.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and easy to install. Using it to cool an upstairs bedroom 15x20 feet with ensuite that does not get cool enough with just central air. Very pleasant sleeping now.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Had to Return this Portable A/C Unit
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a good portable A/C unit, except for the defect on the one I received, since it puts out cold air and is fairly quiet. However, after only three weeks of use, the control buttons on the unit stopped functioning. We could not turn the unit off, change the temperature setting or fan speeds using the buttons. The only way to turn the unit off was to pull the plug. Sometimes this would "reboot" the unit making the control buttons work again for a time, but they would inevitably stop working again. So we returned the unit, which is challenging given its size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: WWII Model Plane Nut

customer_reviews.title: It's what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Installed in bedroom for night time use. Cools the room down well. No noisier than any window unit except it's all inside so you hear all the fan noise. Compressor is quiet. Sometimes we don't even notice it kick in. Occasionally need to empty the condensation pan during high humidity times like after a rain. That would be done away with probably by letting it use room air rather than hooking up the hose that brings in outside air but it would still have to bring air in to replace what the exhaust takes away so it's pretty much a wash that way. Sometimes water condenses on the outside but that's mostly because we like a cold room for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: R. Oswald

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work well.
customer_reviews.text: Not good. Don’t bother buying it. Just not strong enough! It barely cools at all. Thought I’d give it some time, but I can’t even return it now that it’s hot. Disappointed in the product and Amazon Policy.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation! Like very easy! I mean aside from it being a big piece of furniture in itself with 2 giant hoses- it serves its purpose far more than I expected. It works so well my room gets too cold! But you can set a preferred temp. With this heat I don’t care how much of an eye sore it is. It’s clean and looks modern and is and appealing as any space cooler could possibly be I’d say. The dual hose makes such a difference in it’s performance. The noise is apparent but it doesn’t bother me other than I have to put the tv volume higher than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Desire

customer_reviews.title: It ruined a Brazilian cherry floor and is collecting dust, but it is shiny.
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn’t get one star, customer service gets negative stars, save yourself some money and get a window unit or a split system. The customer service is a joke, one you pay $400+ for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Have low expectations if you purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 6X12 travel trailer after reading the excellent reviews. Unit works great, if the temperature isn’t above 70 degrees. Tried it yesterday during an 89 degree day. Would not keep the interior temp. below 80 degrees. We had to cancel our impending 9 day trip to South Dakota. A Consumer Reports article, that I found too late , says that portable ac is a last resort option , when nothing else will work. And that 80 degrees is the best they can achieve on hot days. That being said, they recognize Whynter as the best.
customer_reviews.author: michaelcrim

customer_reviews.title: Filter Housing Rattles
customer_reviews.text: This air conditioner works great. I put a reverse window fan on the opposite side of the house and it cools the entire 2nd floor. Adding a follow up to my initial review after several weeks of use the filter that pulls out on the top of the unit has begun to rattle badly and if you remove and reinstall the filter it will stop for a few minutes but then returns. The noise makes it very hard to go to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling and lower noise than other units
customer_reviews.text: Finally after two unsuccessful AC units from a different manufacturer this unit EXCEEDED expectations. Sanely packaged, clear instructions, and best of all IT WORKS. It would have been nice for a drain hose to have been an option for purchase but I had a short hose that was a perfect fit. Handy remote unit, much lower noise level than the other units (which never cooled). Kudos to the Amazon return policy for the two dysfunctional units. Very highly recommended. Brought my office temperature from 77F to 73F in less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: H. M. Leith

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I had a older and much cheaper (about $250) portable AC unit with a 8000BTU rating with a single hose. This dual hose Whynter unit is just miles better than my old one. It's much quieter and surprisingly a lighter unit to roll around as well. Now to be fair it hasn't been that hot lately so I really can't speak about the cooling performance just yet but it's definitely a lot quieter! I'll update this as soon as the summer really hits in LA.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Kinda bummed out that the FedEx driver was a jerk. Unit was on it's side in the back of the truck and he really was rough in moving it to my place. He carried it by the straps on the side and then tried to set it down upside down. I had to tell him not to do that. The directions are OK, but it is not obvious what to do in what order. I was pleased when I turned it on with how little noise it made and it blasted out cold air. I would recommend putting some type of insulation on the exhaust tube since it gets warm quickly. I used bubble wrap. Will update on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: RageBot

customer_reviews.title: Big and cool
customer_reviews.text: This unit functions well, but is a bit bulkier than I had expected. Dual hoses further add more space connecting to the window bracket. Expandable window bracket works great for my tall primarily horizontally sliding windows. Caster wheels function poorly in my few carpeted rooms causing it to tip unless carefully steadied, though they work great on the tile and hardwood floors. Fan noise is reasonably low. Looking forward to testing how well this handles hot, humid days.
customer_reviews.author: Kadino

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a life saver in the summer! We don't have AC in our apartment and we're on the top floor so it gets really hot. Often 10+ degrees warmer inside than outside. This AC unit has been the difference between sweating all night without any covers or sheets and sleeping comfortably with a comforter on. It doesn't cool down the whole apartment, but it can certainly cool down one small bedroom (~12x12). In my experience it's been able to cool a room down from 85F to 65F. It's noisy, but not that much noisier than the road noise. And I think it's much easier to sleep through noise than excessive heat anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Loud rattling noise - FIXED
customer_reviews.text: I've had this AC for a little over 2 months now and it has begun making an awful rattling noise sporadically. Works great other than that. UPDATE. After some investigation I found the cause of the noise was not enough air flow through the evaporator coil. The dust filter just needed to be cleaned! After cleaning filter with a dry soft brush and running the fan without AC to dry the evaporator out, the noise was completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: efficient quality
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I bought this unit for our heat wave (which was unusual for us). It's was pretty easy to set up, and easy to use controls. Didn't remove a lot of water/humidity so didn't need to empty to basin much at all. I did run a separate dehumidifier because of that. Love that it a 2 hose system, which makes it a lot more efficient to use than a single hose. When it was 90 outside, it kept the house at 69 without much trouble. I have a trilevel and this unit was used to cool the midlevel (kitchen/dining, LR).
customer_reviews.author: J. HaleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Did tons of research before buying this model. Used it for 2 summers in a blazing hot upstairs living room and it consistently lowers the temperature by 10-15 degrees. Reasonably quiet and not an energy hog. Need to start it up early, before it gets hot outside for maximum effectiveness. Very easy to clean and store. The only downside so far is that the coil will rust and need to be sprayed with coil cleaner every few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jingleheimerschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Loud noise and doesn’t cool
customer_reviews.text: After less than a month of regular use. It has started to make a horribly loud noise like an oven fan. It does not cool very well or very much. Massively overrated!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: AC is loud and leaks - returns are a hassle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit last year during the summer. Within a month I noticed that water would leak from from the main body, regardless of whether it is standing on a leveled surface. Super annoying! If you want to return it, you have to pack and ship something that is huge, bulky, and heavy. I typically enjoy mechanical noise, but this aching has a non-uniform noise that makes it sound like the neighbors are listening to music late at night. Not very soothing. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: john sedillo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Less noisy than a window unit, and we think it's more efficient in terms of air movement. We experienced a service issue during operation that required service from the manufacturer. I spoke with Jackie at Whynter, and she was very accommodating in her responsiveness to receive the item back for repair. We should be good to go when the weather heats back up again.
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: It cools great and Is easy to install but the noise level on my unit is too loud. It's well over 70 db when the actual AC Is running and it vibrates quite a bit. Not sure if there is a mechanical issue.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ya

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I found this on the Amazon site. We had a window air conditioner, but it was getting hard for my hubby to lift it in and out every summer. I thought a portable one would make it easier. This one was fairly easy to install, quiet, and very effective in cooling our approximately 600 sq. ft. living room and dining room.
customer_reviews.author: lindaj

customer_reviews.title: quiet cool
customer_reviews.text: Roughly 49db-51db or so with low speed fan, compressor kicking in is almost imperceptible. Cooling is good and no issues with water retention despite high humidity environment (running intermittently, mostly on hotter days and during the night.). Window kit is good quality, but you'll probably need to cut the plastic to length. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MJ Garuckis

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: After one season of use. I stored and now it wont cool for more than a minute without compressor shutting off and blowing hotter than atmosphere air in my apartment. 0/10 don’t buy, it’s cheap, useless, and in every way dissatisfactory. Also, when it was working, very noisy. Buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: AC Slater

customer_reviews.title: Leaking water
customer_reviews.text: This product is 1 month and 1 day old (1 day past the allowable return date) and its leaking water badly out of the unit. All plugs are secure and all vents/airways are free from obstruction. Pretty mad I spent over $400.00 for something which is inoperable after 1 month.... I Do not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Everything said this was the best unit you can buy for this purpose and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything said this was the best unit you can buy for this purpose and they were right. Easy to set up and over performs on what they promised as I have high ceilings and at least eight hundred foot being cooled by it with no problem in 90 degree Heat keeping the temperature 73 and I can get it down to 71 but it gets too cold. If it has durability it's well worth what I paid works better than my old central air
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Tiny remote.  Not cute.
customer_reviews.text: The remote is tiny!, so small I need to use a magnifying glass to see the buttons. A stylus would be helpful to hit just the button I intend to hit. Even smaller are the operating symbols on the tiny buttons. Symbols that would have been much better in English. By the time I remember what each symbol means, summer will be over. Machine cools great. Easy to assemble. Couldn’t find drain hose diameter in instructions so I had to take drain plug knob to Loews and fit tubing. It’s 5/8od. Dropped the darn thing. Glad I was able to find it under the shelf. Or I could not have used unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbaub

customer_reviews.title: Unattractive hoses, noisy, and weak
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement Doesn’t show the two ugly hoses that have to be attached to the window, and because the hose attaches to the air conditioning unit at a weird location, it doesn’t go straight out the window, you’ve got about 4 feet showing. Plus this does not provide anywhere near as much cooling power as a window unit and is just as loud.
customer_reviews.author: KLCINDC

customer_reviews.title: Works well at low setting.
customer_reviews.text: This AC is in a 380 sq ft Rm with 10 ft ceiling and it does a good job keeping it cool to 76F (outside temp. 98F) with the setting at 70F. The most important thing is to INSULATE THE EXHAUST VERY WELL! I have 1 1/2 inch insulation that seems to do the trick, the exhaust "conduit" (hose) is barely warm to the touch. Without insulation, it is REALLY hot.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Wudl

customer_reviews.title: Air conditioner Great! window kit not so good.
customer_reviews.text: Great service, Received product a day early, happy for that. Easy to unpack and install. Window kit insufficient should be better equip with thicker material and insulation at least to fill the gaps. What was provided was not long enough 6inches short. For temp fill we had to use cardboard and tape off gaps...
customer_reviews.author: CHM

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. I was a bit concerned with any portable seeing all the mixed reviews. This unit is reasonably quiet and cools well. I went with the extended warranty just in case. It also has a nice clean and contemporary look to it.
customer_reviews.author: CPcustomer

customer_reviews.title: Love all the Whynter portable air conditioners
customer_reviews.text: Love all the Whynter portable air conditioners. I have one on main floor and second floor. Thinking about getting one for basement also. Don't have central air and window ones were harder and harder for me (69 yrs old) to put in and take out every year. These are easy to install. They don't have the cooling power that window units do, But they really make a difference in this 90 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Cubic/f vs. Sq/f
customer_reviews.text: The measure of efficiency shouldn't be really by square feet but by vubic volume... big difference between a room 20x20 x10 and 20x20x20 both are 400sq/f but one is 4000 cubic f and the other 8000cubic.... can you feel the. difference in cooling.... Well yhis model wasn't strong dnough for the big volume apartment space I have....
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Le Bars

customer_reviews.title: Great dual hose unit
customer_reviews.text: Wow, we live in the east coast and the dual hose system works great. We monitor the air humidity and have only had to switch from ac to dehumidifier once this year. Kept our room nice and cool, loved the timer function, could use longer hose. We had to cut the window plate to fit. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Young

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience, will not purchase another Whynter unit
customer_reviews.text: Today, I noticed that Amazon reduced the price by almost $100, just a few days after we purchased it, perhaps because of the returns they've been getting. The unit is very difficult to install, the window kit is unusable on its own, the drain leaks from the bottom, and the two hoses are enormous, very unwieldy. I am in the process of returning it now but the box it was shipped in was damaged and we are having a hard time finding a suitable box we can use to ship it back. I would have saved myself several headaches by never purchasing this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service (so far)
customer_reviews.text: The exhaust hose fitting won't slide into place on the rear. I'm not sure if they shipped the wrong parts, there's a problem with my unit, or I'm doing something wrong... But after waiting on hold for 45 mins and not being able to talk to a human, I'm S.O.L. for now... I'll update the review if they actually get back to me with something helpful. Very disappointed so far... and I had high hopes after buying one of their fridges and liking it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sean Gilligan

customer_reviews.title: Be Very Cool Enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Hey!!!...Very Cool ac and heavy forgot had wheels!.The two hose idea? Humm why have air inlet hose in hot air outside?.I left the inlet hose inside which has cold air and should be more efficient for faster cooling?.The drain system works when full unit shuts off till drained. Thks Enjoy B Cool B Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Teen Father

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt efficiently cool
customer_reviews.text: The fan is not strong enough, doesn’t move much air and doesn’t cool affectively. Did not touch the humidity level and almost seemed to make it higher. Replaced it with a 5000 BTU window air conditioner that works perfectly. The discharge hose reaches 100° during operation. Kind of defeats the purpose of cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I looked around at several of these before settling on this one. It had good reviews and the dual hose system that I was looking for. It’s in my bedroom and it’s a little noisy but nothing I can’t handle. This was a lifesaver. I work outside all day and to come home to a hot house was miserable. Now I sleep great and I’m very happy my house now has A/C.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cools well;very little condensation!
customer_reviews.text: I use the unit to cool a 12x12 bedroom with a Western South Florida exposure because even the central air isn’t enough plus I can turn the thermostat up and just cool this room! VERY HAPPY!! Works great,very little water to drain and I love the remote. .... I’m not mechanically inclined so read the setup manual carefully and was fairly easy. Hardest part is getting panel SET in the window...instructions didn’t tell u COVERS come off FIXTURES but figured it out! Also customer service answered my setup question well. Extremely happy with the unit. Wish I’d bought it last year !!!
customer_reviews.author: South Florida Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Cool my loft
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and use the loft as my office. The basic AC unit was not adequate so I looked at a "mini split" AC unit but too expensive. The Whynter unit does a good job of cooling the room allowing me to work in comfort. Wish it were a bit quieter but can't have everything.
customer_reviews.author: steve1716

customer_reviews.title: Not too loud, gets bedroom perfectly cool
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this AC so far. Cools down our bedroom perfectly, not too loud, we leave it running all night.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerScientist

customer_reviews.title: Bada da dah dah, I’m lovin’ it!
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s amazing. Super quiet. Like a sniper running around Afghanistan in her bra and panties. Cools my room with a quickness. Will update if anything changes. I work in the same city where Whynter’s headquarters is located. So I’ll have some real info about their customer service if it comes down to it. Also this thing feels like a tank on the outside. Very well built! The only thing that bugs me is that I can’t fully lower my blinds due to the hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Salty

customer_reviews.title: Great when you don’t have central AC
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little noisy, and not as easy to “snap” together as the video would let on, but once we got it together, it worked great. Our windows don’t allow for window units, and our condo doesn’t have central AC so this was a lifesaver. We did have to rig A cardboard extension to accommodate using it in a sliding glass door, but, again, once we got it together, it was terrific. A real lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Vibrations!
customer_reviews.text: At first, it was great. It is quiet enough for the bedroom...until it started with a super loud vibrating noise. It is enough to wake you up. Now I need to see if it is even covered under warranty and a way to pack it to get it back to them.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K.

customer_reviews.title: Failed within months, service is untenable
customer_reviews.text: Went from fairly quiet, to a loud mess within months. It's unfortunate that it's one of the few dual hose models that will fit with my setup as it is... Service was basically useless. Sending it in for repair costs just about as much as a new unit.
customer_reviews.author: o t z

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for about 6 months now and I am very pleased. It will cool a medium sized room quickly. It might just be one of the best purchases I have ever made!
customer_reviews.author: jeff phillips

customer_reviews.title: Get a higher BTU!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 12,000 btu unit but unfortunately is not enough to cool my studio apartment. A 14,000 or higher would have been better. It works if you have higher btu and very small room to cool,
customer_reviews.author: benjamin guitarte

customer_reviews.title: Nice product easy to install and fits need
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this for our upstairs bedroom in Seattle during the summer. Extremely easy to install and works well for our needs. Cools the room pretty fast. Noise level is decent (not too quiet but not too loud).
customer_reviews.author: Chikkus

customer_reviews.title: A/C works as promised and will help cool a room
customer_reviews.text: No issues with delivery here for me. A/C works as promised and will help cool a room. I'm using it in a 350 ft2 studio apartment. I don't think it would do great in anything much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Love it! First started it up did not think I was running. Turned fan speed up to high and the unit is a lot quieter than any other AC I have ever used. After a few seconds the temp in the room started to drop fast. Very satisfied with the AC performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: John I Ostrander

customer_reviews.title: Great AC solution
customer_reviews.text: Great way too cool a room without cooling the entire house. With the dual hoses it cools more efficiently and is energy star rated. You can also use it just as a dehumidifier when it's not that hot but it may be humid. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Bad Air Conditioner
customer_reviews.text: I bought last year base on someone review but don't like at all. Not a good portable air conditioner, not cold enough a small room. Fail to make a cold air when received.
customer_reviews.author: Hai B. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Good cooling unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for a few weeks. I need it on very hot days 98 f to over 100 f, I have it in an RV and start it in the afternoon on very hot days. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Unit will not even cool a 250 sqr ft bedroom
customer_reviews.text: The unit is terrible compared to other 12000 BTU systems. Have this unit upstairs in a small bedroom. Does not bring the temperature down and barely puts out any cold air. We have a second unit from another brand downstairs in a living area over 3x the size and it more than keeps the temp down. Would not recommend this to an enemy, none the less a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS WHAT IT IS ADVERTISED AS
customer_reviews.text: IT DOES COOL SEVERAL ROOMS AT A TIME - BECAUSE THE WINDOW WAS MUCH WIDER THAN THE PRODUCT RECOMMENDED AND CAME WITH (I BUILT A WOOD INSERT TO MAKE THE CONNECTIONS) IT WAS FAIRLY EASY TO INSTALL - WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO OTHERS. NOTE: I AM FEMALE AND 67 YEARS OLD, SO ALL YOU LADIES OUT THERE DON'T BE AFFRAID TO TRY THIS PRODUCT, .
customer_reviews.author: L H

customer_reviews.title: Great noise level but had a missing part
customer_reviews.text: The noise level is perfect and the best I've experienced for an indoor portable aircon. The sound equates to low level white noise. Perfect the bedroom or living room. Unfortunately it was delivered missing the attachment that connects the out flow exhaust from the aircon machine to the large tube. I am unsure how to source another attachment. Ive been required to improvise with tape for now.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Effective AC, though Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great AC, cooled my space quickly and effectively. Only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because it is REALLY heavy, which cuts down the portability.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K.

customer_reviews.title: Great AC with little noise
customer_reviews.text: This AC unit has worked great. It was super easy to install and is pretty quiet. It cools down are pretty large room really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: long term review
customer_reviews.text: The unit cools ok for my application. It has always leaked water out of the bottom from time to time. I have a drain hose hooked to it at all times but it continues to be a problem. I would recommend that you put something under it to catch water.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fox

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working about 35 days after purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was great first 30 days then broke after that like day 40. No cold air.
customer_reviews.author: tech guy dm

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: Everyone claimed this product was the end all be all for portable AC units, but i must have gotten a defective one... it failed right as a California heatwave hit. Started short cycling, but to be honest, even from day 1, it didn't cool that well
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Parts Supply Don't Buy this Product
customer_reviews.text: Got the order on time. Opened the box and the unit does not have the right parts. Only one hose connector to the base unit and extra hose connector for venting to the outside. 95 degrees and now the customer support number for the manufacturer will not answer. Constantly on hold. Amazon Prime recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck T.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design!
customer_reviews.text: This unit does an adequate job of cooling, but the dehumidifier design is horrible. We don’t see any reason why there is not a bucket to empty; instead we need to roll it outside and remove the drain plug. We are trying to attach a hose to provide continuous drainage, but that may require cutting a hole in our wall to provide outdoor drainage. The space around the area you attach a hose is also so small, working with a hose is extremely difficult. Poor overall design for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Portable
customer_reviews.text: Hoses are big and bulky . Use in bedroom noise could be a little more quiet to soot me.
customer_reviews.author: william townsend

customer_reviews.title: It's working!
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked everything up today and it's doing very well so far. I was amazed at how fast it cool the living room, but I'll need to order a stand because instructions state to keep hoses as straight as possible, but I love how it's working so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christine R. Rickett

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: The unit works very well. The noise level is very low.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Report awarded highest rating and seem better built than big box store units.
customer_reviews.text: Mother’s Las Vegas house A/C failed in July. This Whynter and a SECOND 12000 BTU Whynter and 3 8000 LG units keep her cool until the attic was insulated and the roof A/C got repaired. The Whynter are quieter while having a higher output.
customer_reviews.author: Carl O. Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Space coverage is limited this coverage is limited to be in front of it to get cold air
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to cover the amount of space since the direction of the vent is limited in movement it just goes straight out
customer_reviews.author: Allen Dana

customer_reviews.title: Damaged really disappointed I’m OCD and 500.00 have the right to be.
customer_reviews.text: I got this and noticed this damage that had been done but I haven’t noticed anything bad except little buzzing and so I’m just hoping the air flow power still be as strong for normal amount of length for the price..?
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Tarol Hisakazu Kao

customer_reviews.title: not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: it is not as quiet as I had anticipated and it doesn't cool as well as I had hoped. If it wasn't so heavy I would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Total waste of my time.
customer_reviews.text: This air conditioner is not remotely good at keeping my room cool. I had a unit prior that was lower btu from a less reputable company and completely outperformed this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money a little noisy but good buy.
customer_reviews.text: would have probably given it five stars if it had a thermostat that would turn it on and turn it off. Bought it for my bonus room and does really well puts out a lot of cold air.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my bedroom. It does a great job cooling and is less noisy than a window unit. The vent tubing is a little cumbersome but fairly easy to set up. You will need some weather striping to get a good seal to the window frame. I’ve emptied the drain a couple times, but it really doesn’t accumulate very fast. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Decent unit. Hoses too short, bit noisy, not as much cooling power as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cool and comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: The 'pink' noise is very low and innocuous. Lots of cool air! My summer just got a lot more comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: #1clarkgirl

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: The ac itself is quite loud and it does cool the room ok. My biggest gripe with it is draining the water frequently, so there wasn’t much run time. I recommend getting the drain hose so that the ac can continuously run. Overall for how expensive this was I expected a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: cools good
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for the bedroom as our windows won't do a window unit. It cools good, but much louder than a window unit, so another room it would be great - when the compressor kicks in, its loud - also the back filter rattles once in a while
customer_reviews.author: VAR Concerned

customer_reviews.title: does not cool very well
customer_reviews.text: the installation of the 2nd duct for outside air does not give the unit the capacity to provide cooler air when the outside temperature is over 75 degrees. the thermostat on the unit can be set down to 67 degrees but is completely worthless when the unit cannot even cool the room to 74 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: thscpa

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: This unit saved us during hot weather in our historical home. The unit was rated one of the top 10 from Consumer Reports and we love it! It is compact, quiet and cools our lower level home (500 sq feet) beautifully. It was easy to install and easy to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: like: cools room as advertised Dislike: noisy (but aren't they all)
customer_reviews.author: Kofi D

customer_reviews.title: Failed just after return window
customer_reviews.text: Failed the day after the return window. One month! Don’t do it. Doesn’t even cool half of what it says it should.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Moore

customer_reviews.title: perfect AC for our loft area.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and keeps our loft area perfect temperature for summer!
customer_reviews.author: Holbrook Alvey

customer_reviews.title: For best performance, insulate the exhaust hose with a 6" insulating sleeve from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.text: My insulated double garage is now cool enough to work in. Unit is fairly quiet. I am pleased with the ease of installation and with the quality of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. I actually got cold
customer_reviews.text: We bought this air conditioner to use in our tent. We tried it out in a state park in Florida during the month of July. It worked great. I actually got cold.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Isbell

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, lightweight, quality, instant cold air
customer_reviews.text: Instant cold air, beautiful finish, quality a/c, one of the lighter weight ones comes with rollers already installed, makes it easy to install. Can easily be rolled wherever you want to put it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Mills

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Item was as listed and arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very low output air speed.
customer_reviews.text: The exit air speed is very low. Very little difference between 3 fan speeds. If used to cool a bed room and allowed some time, It will be a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Great portable A/C unit
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all, easy install, works great, noise is expected and tolerable. Dual hose is the only way to go, doesn't take any conditioned air out of the room. I've only used it once and it cooled a 350 sq/ft room a 1 degree every 10 minutes. Room temperature 76 outside 65 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boland

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely loud. It cools the room moderately but it’s impossible to sleep through the noise. The directions are very far from straight forward and I would not recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: You definitely need the drain hose.  I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly! It cools the room quickly and not noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Portable AC that works
customer_reviews.text: Although we use it is an "open" area, the main living area we need cooled is cooled very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Babb

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t nearly as difficult to install as some have noted in the comments. So far it has had no problem cooling a large room in 90 degree weather. We’ll see how it does when it’s 105.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Marotta

product_meta.title: Whynter Elite ARC-122DS 12,000 BTU Dual Hose Portable Air Conditioner, Dehumidifier, Fan with Activated Carbon Filter plus Storage bag for Rooms up to 400 sq ft
product_meta.description: Style Name:Air ConditionerA key feature of this portable air conditioner is its compact size and dual-hose system which facilitates better space utilization and more efficient cooling. The Whynter ARC-122DS portable air conditioner is the ideal solution for the warm spots in your home, office, server room or other constrained area. Portable and easy to set up, this portable air conditioner offers cooling relief for any area where excess humidity and heat cannot be remedied by traditional air conditioning. The unit can be easily setup in almost any indoor location and is most commonly used in data closets/server rooms, bedrooms, classrooms and garages or workshops. The Whynter ARC-122DS portable air conditioner provides 12,000 BTU cooling output while maintaining a compact and portable profile. The dehumidifier mode allows you to extract 76 pints of excess moisture during a 24-hour period. Equipped with an intake and exhaust hose, this system allows for more air intake, cooling power, and constant air pressure, which results to a faster cooling rate compared to single-hose units (can be operated as single hose as well). save energy and money by setting the unit to run only when you need it. Using the 24 hour programmable timer, the ARC-122DS can efficiently cool your space before you even get there. The timer allows you to set the unit to cycle on automatically, or once it is on, you can set it to automatically turn off. Equipped with a remote control that can easily control the Speed, temperature, and dehumidifier settings even from a distance, the Whynter ARC-122DS also comes with rolling casters that will allow you to move the portable air conditioner room to room. Its programmable features, operating modes, and adaptable design make this unit the perfect option for keeping rooms up to 400 square feet cool and comfortable (ambient temperature and humidity may influence optimum performance).cooling power:12000. Upgraded Plastic window kit included.
feature_bullets: * Three operational modes: air conditioner, fan or dehumidifier. This unit can cool up to a 400 square feet space (ambient temperature and humidity may influence optimum performance)
* Remote control, activated carbon air filter, washable pre-filter, and product manual packaged inside exhaust hose; Noise level (dBA): <52
* AWARD WINNING : 1. Good Housekeeping's "Best Portable Air Conditioners to Buy in 2019" 2. The New York Times Wirecutter named "the most efficient and fastest cooling portable AC"

* Full thermostatic control (61°F - 89°F) with digital readout, 24 hour programmable timer; Eco-friendly CFC free Green R-410A refrigerant; Patented auto drain function fully exhausts all condensate automatically in most environments
* Full installation set includes extendable exhaust and intake hose (up to 60") and window kit (up to 46") Max. window kit length = 46" , Min. window kit length = 20".
* Maximum power consumption: 1000W / 9.0A. Power supply: 115 V / 60Hz / 1 Phase; Dehumidifying capacity of 76 pints per day; 3 fan speeds; Air Flow (at high speed): 264m3/h / 155CFM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars387 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Portable Air Conditioner^Remote Control^Exhaust Hose^Window Kit
